availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James M. Kindred (Quartermaster Sgt., 8th KY Vol. Inf.)

body.p: Madison County, Kentucky, common school teacher and soldier. Kentucky native. Common school teacher in Madison County in 1860. Mustered into service as a sergeant in the 8th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) on January 30, 1862, in Lebanon, Kentucky. Promoted to Quartermaster Sergeant in March 1862. Promoted to regimental quartermaster on June 1, 1863. Mustered out of service on November 17, 1864.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, District no. 3, p. 249. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, District no. 1, p. 278. Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 783. Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 223.
